title: British Gas Makes Less Money Because of Warm Weather
summary: British Gas, a big energy company in the UK, made less profit in 2025 because the weather was warmer. When it's warm, people use less heating, so British Gas sold less energy. This cost them £80 million. Also, some customers switched to cheaper energy plans, which hurt profits too. Even though profits fell, British Gas got more customers for the first time in over ten years. They now have 7.5 million customers after taking on customers from other companies that closed. The company's boss said it was a tough year, but they are trying to grow. British Gas is part of a bigger group called Centrica, which also saw profits drop. Experts say lower energy prices and less price change made it hard for Centrica to make money. The company paid out money to shareholders but will stop buying back shares to invest in new projects like a nuclear power plant.

background_read: British Gas is a company in the UK that sells gas and electricity to homes. When people use less energy, like in warm weather, the company makes less money. Profits are important for companies to grow and pay workers. Centrica is the parent company that owns British Gas and other energy businesses. Companies often change their plans, like offering different energy tariffs, to attract customers. Investing in projects like power plants helps companies prepare for the future.

WHAT: British Gas made less profit because of warm weather and customers switching to cheaper plans, but gained more customers.
WHERE: In the UK, including projects like Sizewell C in Suffolk.
WHY: To explain how weather and market changes affect energy companies' profits and growth.
